Fine and Decorative Arts - NYU Libraries                               This is the "Fine and Decorative Arts" guide.      Alternate Page for Screenreader Users      Skip to Page Content                                             Fine and Decorative Arts This guide is intended for the beginning researcher in the fine and decorative arts.        Last update: May 30, 2014        URL: http://guides.nyu.edu/content_mobile.php?pid=36138                                                                          Beginning Research                                                                                  Need Research Help?                 If you feel you would benefit from a consultation with Bobst Library's art librarian, just send an email to:   tom.mcnulty@nyu.edu   -or-   call: 212.998.2519                                                Introduction                 This guide is intended for the beginning researcher in the fine and decorative arts. The resources listed below are the recommended starting points for general research. For specialized sources in art education and other arts-related professions, click on the relevant subject-specific tab above.                                             A Few Pointers                   Unlike practitioners in other disciplines, art historians continue to rely primarily upon print materials. Relative to that of other fields, for example, the professional and scholarly literature of art history remains undigitized.   If you're researching a work of art by a known (named) artist, begin with the artist's catalogue raisonne. To find these indispensible research tools, simply do a keyword search in Bobcat and enter: <artist's surname> and raisonne. For example: Warhol and raisonne. The catalogue raisonne entry usually provides extensive bibliography of sources in which the sought-after work is illustrated and/or discussed.   If you're really lost, don't hesitate to contact Tom McNulty, the art librarian! ( tom.mcnulty@nyu.edu )                                                       close                                                                                                          Bibliographies                                                                                  Research Tip                 Looking for extensive bibliography on an artist, style or period?   Look for a recently-completed PhD dissertation; most of the more recent titles are now available in full-text.   To search dissertations, go to Proquest Digital Dissertations .                                             General Bibliographies                   Arntzen, Etta and Robert Rainwater. Guide to the Literature of Art History . Chicago: American Library Association, 1980. For the advanced researcher, this major work describes over 4,000 items with an emphasis on works in the western languages. See Chamberlain (below) for earlier resources. Bobst REF1 Z5931 .A67   Chamberlain, Mary W. Guide to Art Reference Books . Chicago: American Library Association, 1959. While dated, Chamberlain's Guide is an essential work for the advanced researcher. Provides annotated bibliography to some 2,500 standard resources. Bobst REF1 Z5931 .C45   Ehresmann, Donald L. Fine Arts: A Bibliographic Guide to Basic Reference Works, Histories and Handbooks . 2nd ed. Littleton, CO: Libraries Unlimited, 1979. Provides descriptive annotations to over 1,650 reference works, histories and handbooks. Bobst REF1 Z5931 .E47 1990                                               Decorative Arts Bibliographies                   Ames, Kenneth L. and Gerald W.R. Ward. Decorative Arts and Household Furnishing in America 1650-1920: An Annotated Bibliography . Winterthur, DE: The Henry Francis du Pont Winterthur Museum, 1989. Bobst REF1 Z5956.D3 D43 1989 . Annotated bibliography of books, articles, and exhibition catalogs arranged by decorative arts category.   DeWinter, Patrick. European Decorative Arts 1400-1600 . Boston: G.K. Hall & Col, 1988. Bobst REF1 Z5956.D3 D38 1988 . Brief annotations to over 2,200 reference to selected material dealing with various types of furnishing made for the Church, the palace and the home.   Ehresmann, Donald L. Applied and Decorative Arts: A Bibliographic Guide . 2nd ed. Englewood, CO: Libraries Unlimited, 1992. Bobst REF1 Z5956.A68 E47 1991 .   Sokol, David M. American Decorative Arts and Old World Influences . Detroit: Gale Research Company, 1980. Bobst REF1 Z5956.A68 S66 .                                                    close                                                                                                          Databases                                                                                  Which database should I use?                 Not sure where to start? Ask the art librarian:    tom.mcnulty@nyu.edu                                                 Fine & Decorative Arts -- Databases                    Art and Architecture Complete (EBSCO) This database provides full-text coverage of 380 periodicals and more than 220 books. In addition, Art & Architecture Complete offers cover-to-cover indexing and abstracts for more than 780 academic journals, magazines and trade publications, as well as for over 230 books. The database also provides selective coverage for 70 additional publications and an Image Collection of over 63,000 images provided by Picture Desk and others. Full-text coverage dates back to 1937. Subjects covered include antiques, art and art history, interior and landscape design, and much more. ARTbibliographies Modern Excellent starting point for research in 19th and 20th century art, architecture, and design. Provides indexing to periodicals, books, exhibition catalogs and dissertations from 1984 to the present. Articles are abstracted from 500 major international art, photography and design journals and museum bulletins. Abstracts of articles in foreign journals are provided in English. Art Index Retrospective 1929-1983 Provides citations to articles and book reviews published in more than 450 periodicals, yearbooks, and museum bulletins in all fields related to the arts including archaeology, architecture, art history, city planning, industrial design, interior design, and landscape design. International coverage. Art Full Text 1983 - present Note: this picks up where Art Index Retrospective ends. Art Source Art Source covers a broad range of related subjects, from fine, decorative and commercial art, to various areas of architecture and architectural design. Bibliography of the History of Art BHA abstracts books, periodicals, exhibition catalogs and dissertations relating to post-classical European and Post Columbian American art; its successor, IBA (Proquest) provides updated coverage. International Bibliography of Art 2008 - present. Picks up where Bibliography of the History of Art ends.                                                   close                                                                                                          Encyclopedias and Handbooks                                                                                  Basic Reference Sources                 Encyclopedias     The Dictionary of Art . New York: Grove's Dictionaries, 1996. 34 volumes. Lengthy, signed articles on fine arts, decorative arts, architecture and related disciplines. Online version is one component of Oxford Art Online . Bobst REF1 N31.D5 1996   Encyclopedia of World Art . 16 vols. NewYork: McGraw Hill, 1959. Lengthy, signed essays with bibliographies on artists, movements, individual works, etc. Well illustrated, some color. Volume 15 (Index) provides citations to the other 14 volumes. Bobst REF1 N31     Tansey, Richard G. and Fred S. Kleiner. Gardner's Art Through the Ages . 12th ed. New York: Harcourt Brace, 2005. Bobst N5300.G25 2004       Handbooks     Barnet, Sylvan. A Short Guide to Writing About Art . 6th ed. Boston: Little, Brown, 20005. Standard guide for the beginning student of aesthetics and art history, with sections on analysis of art objects, writing essays and preparing research papers. Bobst REF1 N7476 .B37 2000   Jones, Lois Swan. Art Information: Research Methods and Resources . 3rd ed. Dubuque, IA: Kendall/Hunt, 1990. For beginning or advanced researchers, provides a good general overview of the research process. Annotated bibliography of reference sources, arranged by broad subject, follows the lengthy essay on art research methodology. Bobst REF1 N85 .J64 1990     Kleinbauer, W. Eugene and Thomas P. Slavens. Research Guide To The History of Western Art. Chicago: American Library Association, 1982. Bobst REF1 N380 .K56 1980                   Comments (0)                                              close                                                                                                          Biography/Signatures                                                                                                                Marks - Decorative Arts                                                                                  General Resources (Marks)                 The most important resources for identifying marks on decorative arts objects are located in the Reference Room, 1st Floor. Many additional tools are located in the General Stacks (7th Floor). Consult BobCat for specific call numbers.   Marks-Pottery and Porcelain     Ceramic Makers' Marks. Erica Gibson. Walnut Creek, CA: Left Coast Press, c2011. BOBST REF1 NK4215 .G53 2011.   Encyclopaedia of British Pottery and Porcelain Marks . Geoffrey A. Godden. London: Barrie & Jenkins, 1992. Bobst REF1 NK4085 .G63 1992   Handbook of Pottery and Porcelain Marks . John Patrick Cushion. London: Faber, 1996. Bobst REF1 NK4215.C8 1996   Marks & Monograms on European and Oriental Pottery and Porcelain . By Wm. Chaffers, Edited by Frederick Lichfield, assisted by R. L. Hobson [and] Justus M Brinkman. BOBST REF1 NK4085 .G63 1992   New Handbook of British Pottery & Porcelain Marks . Geoffrey A. Godden. London: Barrie & Jenkins, 1999. Bobst REF1 NK4085.G635 1999   Pottery & Porcelain Marks. Gordon Lang ; American consultant Ellen Paul Denker. London: Miller's, 1995. Bobst REF1 NK4215 .L36 1995                                                       close                                                                            Research Tip:                 Trying to identify the signature of a major artist? Check the artist's catalogue raisonne. These often provide numerous examples of signatures over the course of their subject artist's lifetime.   To find a catalogue raisonne, simply search Bobcat for the words artist's name and raisonne; for example:   warhol and raisonne                                                Selected Biographical Sources                    Bénézit, E. (Emmanuel). Dictionnaire critique et documentaire des peintres, sculpteurs, dessinateurs et graveurs ... Paris : Gründ, c1999. Bobst REF1 N40 .B47 1999. This 14-volume reference work includes basic biographical sketches, as well as historical prices for works, museum locations, and signature examples.      Biography & Genealogy Master Index . This online source indexes the contents of hundreds of biographical dictionaries. A recommended starting point for biographical research on Artists.    Biography Reference Bank . Offers full-text online access to biographies of artists, designers, architects and other visual arts professionals.    Biography Resource Center . Extensive coverage of biographical material culled from a wide array of reference titles.    Contemporary Artists . Chicago/London: St. James Press. (Latest edition only). Bobst REF1 N6490.C6567.              Comments (0)                                         Signature Sources                    Caplan, H.H. The Classified Directory of Artists Sginatures, Symbols & monograms with new U.K. Additions . London: Paul Grahame Publishing Co., 1987. Bobst REF1 N45.C36 1987.    Castagno, John. African, Asian, and Middle Eastern Artists: Signatures and Monograms from 1800: a Directory . Lanham, MD: Scarecrow, 2009. Bobst REF1 N45.C369 2009.    _____. Artists' Monograms and Indiscernible Signatures: An International Directory, 1800-1991 . Metuchen, NJ: Scarecrow, 1991. Bobst REF1 N45.C374 1991.    _____. European Artists: Signatures and Monograms, 1800-1990 . Bobst REF1 N45.C38 1990.    _____. Old Masters: Signatures and Monograms, 1400-Born 1800 . Lanham, MD: Scarecrow, 1996. Bobst REF1 N45.C39 1996.              Comments (0)                                              close                                                                                                          Images                                                           This link points to an external URL. Go there now .                               close                                                                                                          Art Education and Therapy                                                                                  Research Tip                 The study of art education spans many subjects, besides the obvious (art and education). For pointers to resources in psychology, sociology, theater and performance studies, and other relevant disciplines, consult the complete list of subject guides found on the library's website under "Research Assistance."                                             Art Education -- Research Databases                 Art Education - General Databases   These are the most widely-used databases for finding articles in journals, chapters in books, and other materials of interest to the art education researcher. More specialized databases are found in the box below.     ArtBibliographies Modern , 1974-Present.   Excellent starting point for research in 19th and 20th century art, architecture, and design. Provides indexing to periodicals, books, exhibition catalogs and dissertations from 1984 to the present. Articles are abstracted from 500 major international art, photography and design journals and museum bulletins. Abstracts of articles in foreign journals are provided in English.     Art Full Text , 1984-Present. New York: H. W. Wilson. Art Index Retrospective , 1929-1984. New York: H. W. Wilson.   Provides citations to articles and book reviews published in more than 450 periodicals, yearbooks, and museum bulletins in all fields related to the arts including archaeology, architecture, art history, city planning, industrial design, interior design, and landscape design. International coverage.     Bibliography of the History of Art , 1973-Present.   BHA abstracts books, periodicals, exhibition catalogs and dissertations relating to post-classical European and Post Columbian American art.     ERIC .The ERIC (Educational Resources Information Center) database is sponsored by the U.S. Department of Education to provide extensive access to educational-related literature. The ERIC database corresponds to two printed journals: Resources in Education (RIE) and Current Index to Journals in Education (CIJE). Both journals provide access to some 14,000 documents and over 20,000 journal articles per year.                                                      close                                                                                                          Arts Administration                                                                                  Arts Administration Research                 The field of arts administration is highly interdisciplinary. To find subject-specific content on related topics, see the associated Research Guides. For example, students interested in researching Museums and Museum Education should consult the Research Guide for Education.                                             Visual Arts Administration Databases                 The following represent recommended databases for visual arts administration research.       EconLit provides indexing and full text of lengthy articles in Economics, including the economics of art collecting and related topics.    ABI/Inform indexes journals, magazines, newspapers and other materials of interest to arts administrators' both for- and not-for-profit institutions covered.    PAIS is particularly useful for research involving arts and public policy, urban renewal/revitalization, etc.                                                     close                                                                                                          Subject Librarian                                                           Tom McNulty Contact Info: Location: Bobst Library, Mezzanine   Phone: 212.998.2519   tom.mcnulty@nyu.edu Send Email  Subjects: Fine Arts and Museum Studies          Links: Profile & Guides                               close                                                                 Description  Loading content... please wait                                     More Information  Loading content... please wait       Close window                           ^ Top  |  Home Page  |  Full Site                                           Powered by Springshare and iWebKit.
